attributes.action: Reinstate the closed section of the Central Line between Epping and Ongar
attributes.additional_details: The tracks are still there from Epping tube station all the way to Ongar, and although heritage services run on the old line there is no physical connection to the Central Line at Epping. It wouldn’t cost too much to reinstate the link between the two towns. Also, get both Epping and Ongar councils on board, and hopefully they both will support the idea.
attributes.background: I want the Goverment/Parliament to ask Transport for London/London Underground to look into the possibility to reinstating the closed section of the Central Line between Epping and Ongar. This link between the two towns was closed in 1994 by London Underground.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Transport for London is the responsibility of the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
